org.scec.param
Class Parameter

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--org.scec.param.Parameter
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable, NamedObjectAPI, ParameterAPI
Direct Known Subclasses:
DependentParameter
public abstract class Parameter
extends java.lang.Object
implements ParameterAPI

Title: Parameter
Description: Base implementation for ParameterAPI of common functionality accross all parameter subclasses. The common fields with get and setters are here, as well as a default constructor that sets all these fields, and the setValue field that always checks if the value is allowed before setting.
Copyright: Copyright (c) 2001
Company:

Change History: 11/29/2001 - SWR - Added String units field with get and set methods

See Also:
ParameterAPI

Constructor Detail

Parameter

public Parameter()
Empty no-arg constructor.

Parameter

public Parameter(java.lang.String name,
                 ParameterConstraintAPI constraint,
                 java.lang.String units,
                 java.lang.Object value)
          throws ConstraintException
This is the main constructor. All subclass constructors call this one. Constraints must be set first, because the value may not be an allowed one. Null values are always allowed in the constructor.
Parameters:
name - Name of this parameter
constraint - Constraints for this Parameter. May be set to null
units - The units for this parameter
value - The value object of this parameter.
Throws:
ConstraintException - Description of the Exception
ConstraintException - This is thrown if the passes in parameter is not allowed
Method Detail

getConstraintName

public java.lang.String getConstraintName()
Every parameter constraint has a name, this function sets that name. Defaults to the name of the parameter
Specified by:
getConstraintName in interface ParameterAPI
Returns:
The name value

              throws ConstraintException,
                     ParameterException
Set's the parameter's value.

setValue in interface ParameterAPI
Parameters:
value - The new value for this Parameter
Throws:
ParameterException - Thrown if the object is currenlty not editable

setNonEditable

public void setNonEditable()
Disables editing units, info, constraints, et. Basically all set()s disabled except for setValue(). Once set non-editable, it cannot be set back.
Specified by:
setNonEditable in interface ParameterAPI

getValue

Returns the parameter's value. Each subclass defines what type of object. it returns

isAllowed

public boolean isAllowed(java.lang.Object obj)
Uses the constraint object to determine if the new value being set is allowed. If no Constraints are present all values are allowed. This function is now available to all subclasses, since any type of constraint object follows the same api.
Specified by:
isAllowed in interface ParameterAPI
Parameters:
obj - Object to check if allowed via constraints
Returns:
True if the value is allowed
